security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill containing only documentation and migration guidance. No executable code, network operations, or filesystem modifications. Safe for publishing.

content.value_statement: Opus 4.5 offers improved performance over Sonnet 4.0, Sonnet 4.5, and Opus 4.1. This skill automates the migration of your codebase including model string updates, beta header adjustments, and effort parameter configuration for all supported platforms.
actual_capabilities: Updates model strings for Anthropic API, AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex AI, and Azure AI Foundry
Removes unsupported beta headers and adds effort parameter set to high
Applies prompt adjustments for known Opus 4.5 behavioral differences
Handles Sonnet 4.0, Sonnet 4.5, and Opus 4.1 source models
Summarizes all changes made during migration
limitations: Does not migrate Haiku 4.5 models or earlier versions
Only updates model strings and adds snippets; does not refactor user prompts
Prompt adjustments are applied only if user requests them or reports specific issues
Does not migrate to Haiku models

use_cases.title: Update API Calls
use_cases.description: Automatically update Python, TypeScript, or raw API calls to use Opus 4.5 model strings across all platforms.

use_cases.title: Fix Behavioral Issues
use_cases.description: Apply prompt snippets to address common Opus 4.5 issues like tool overtriggering and over-engineering.

use_cases.title: Batch Migration
use_cases.description: Migrate entire codebases across multiple platforms with detailed change summaries and tracking.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate my codebase from Sonnet 4.0 to Opus 4.5. Update all model strings and API calls to use the new Opus 4.5 model.

prompt_templates.title: With Effort Parameter
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate my API calls to Opus 4.5 with the effort parameter set to high for best performance.

prompt_templates.title: Platform Specific
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate my AWS Bedrock codebase from Opus 4.1 to Opus 4.5. Update model strings and remove unsupported beta headers.

prompt_templates.title: Behavioral Fixes
prompt_templates.prompt: My Opus 4.5 migration is causing tools to trigger too frequently. Apply the tool overtriggering fixes from the prompt-snippets.

best_practices: Test migrations in a staging environment before deploying to production
Apply prompt adjustments only when users report specific issues
Verify that effort parameter is appropriate for your use case after migration

Migrating Haiku models which are not supported by this skill

faq.question: Does this skill migrate from Haiku models?
faq.answer: No. This skill only migrates Sonnet 4.0, Sonnet 4.5, and Opus 4.1. Haiku models are not supported.

faq.question: What platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: It supports Anthropic API, AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex AI, and Azure AI Foundry.

faq.question: What is the effort parameter?
faq.answer: Effort controls how eagerly Claude spends tokens. High effort gives best performance. This skill adds it set to high.

faq.question: Is my data safe during migration?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads and modifies your code files. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why are tools triggering more after migration?
faq.answer: Opus 4.5 is more responsive to prompts. Use the tool overtriggering fix from prompt-snippets to soften aggressive language.

faq.question: How is Opus 4.5 different from Opus 4.1?
faq.answer: Opus 4.5 has better performance but may overtrigger tools, over-engineer solutions, or be sensitive to the word think without extended thinking enabled.
